stanza.line: Who is it that says most which can say moremore
Than this rich praise that you alone are youyou
In whose confine immured is the storestore
Which should example where your equal grewgrew
Lean penury within that pen doth dwelldwell
That to his subject lends not some small gloryglory
But he that writes of you if he can telltell
That you are you so dignifies his storystory
Let him but copy what in you is writwrit
Not making worse what nature made so clearclear
And such a counterpart shall fame his witwit
Making his style admired every wherewhere
You to your beauteous blessings add a cursecurse
Being fond on praise which makes your praises worseworse
